channel.title: Hamachi going nuts
channel.description:
kk, I think you know what the subject is about. So let's skip the intro :P
I have my own server, hamachi has always worked and boom, one day (maybe a week) my hamachi keep telling setting up and a huge pop up coems in saying "Failed to configure Hamachi network adapter.
Configuration problem is most likely caused by your firewalling software blocking DHCP traffic on Hamachi adapter. Please make sure that UDP traffic from local port 68 to port 67 at 5.0.0.1 is allowed. Alternatively you can try completely disabling the firewall on Hamachi adapter.
If neither of the above helps or you don't understand this message, visit our Support Forums, report the problem and you will get help.
Would you like for Hamachi to keep trying to configure the adapter while you adjust your firewall settings ?"
I am using Mcafee Securitycenter if that could help you people get the problem.
Thank you very much.

item.title: Hamachi going nuts
item.dc:creator: @Java_Owns Java Owns
item.description:
@Java_Owns wrote:

If you have Windows Then Un-install Mcaffee security centre (or dont use it) Install AVG free and put your windows firewall settings to highest.

Re-install

Hamachi

and try again (YOU WILL HAVE TO PUT ALL URE SERVERS UP AGAIN)

hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: Hamachi going nuts

item.description:
@I_Im4eversmart_I wrote:

kk, I think you know what the subject is about. So let’s skip the intro

I have my own server, hamachi has always worked and boom, one day (maybe a week) my hamachi keep telling setting up and a huge pop up coems in saying "Failed to configure Hamachi network adapter.

Configuration problem is most likely caused by your firewalling software
blocking DHCP traffic on Hamachi adapter. Please make sure that UDP
traffic from local port 68 to port 67 at 5.0.0.1 is allowed. Alternatively

If neither of the above helps or you don’t understand this message, visit

Would you like for Hamachi to keep trying to configure the adapter while
you adjust your firewall settings ?"
